Package org.sopra.api

Interface EnergyNodeConfig

public interface EnergyNodeConfig
This interface provides configuration parameters for energy nodes as described in the SoPra manual.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    double getAdjustmentCost​(ConsumerType type)
    Returns costs for executing single adjustment command for given consumer.
    double getAdjustmentCost​(ProducerType type)
    Returns costs for executing single adjustment command for given producer.
    int getAdjustmentTime​(ConsumerType type)
    Returns the consumer dependent adjustment time.
    int getAdjustmentTime​(ProducerType type)
    Returns the producer dependent adjustment time.
    double getBasicConstructionCost​(ProducerType type)
    Returns basic construction cost for building a producer of given type.
    double getCostPerUnit​(ConsumerType type)
    The earning (positive cost) for each consumed unit of energy.
    double getCostPerUnit​(ProducerType type)
    The cost for each produced unit of energy.
    double[] getLoadProfileCity()
    Returns an array of percentage values of required energy levels of a city over a day.
    double[] getLoadProfileCommercialPark()
    Returns an array of percentage values of required energy levels of a commercial park over a day.
    int getMaximumPower​(ConsumerType type)
    Returns consumer type dependent maximum power.
    int getMaximumPower​(ProducerType type)
    Returns producer type dependent maximum power.
    double getPenaltyCost​(ConsumerType type)
    Returns consumer dependent weighting factor for energy which required but not produced.
    double getPenaltyCost​(ProducerType type)
    Returns producer dependent weighting factor for energy which was produced but not consumed.

  • Method Details

    • getMaximumPower

      int getMaximumPower​(ProducerType type)
      Returns producer type dependent maximum power.
      Parameters:
      type - Producer type
      Returns:
      Maximum energy level

    • getMaximumPower

      int getMaximumPower​(ConsumerType type)
      Returns consumer type dependent maximum power.
      Parameters:
      type - Consumer type
      Returns:
      Maximum energy level

    • getBasicConstructionCost

      double getBasicConstructionCost​(ProducerType type)
      Returns basic construction cost for building a producer of given type. The location dependent multiplication factor needs to be considered to determine actual building costs.
      Parameters:
      type - Producer Type
      Returns:
      Basic construction costs
      See Also:
      ConstructionCostCalculator, PlantLocation.getLocationMultiplicator()

    • getAdjustmentTime

      int getAdjustmentTime​(ProducerType type)
      Returns the producer dependent adjustment time.
      Parameters:
      type - Producer type
      Returns:
      Adjustment time in rounds

    • getAdjustmentTime

      int getAdjustmentTime​(ConsumerType type)
      Returns the consumer dependent adjustment time.
      Parameters:
      type - Consumer type
      Returns:
      Adjustment time in rounds

    • getAdjustmentCost

      double getAdjustmentCost​(ProducerType type)
      Returns costs for executing single adjustment command for given producer.

      Returned double value is always negative.

      Parameters:
      type - Producer type
      Returns:
      Cost for executing single adjustment command

    • getAdjustmentCost

      double getAdjustmentCost​(ConsumerType type)
      Returns costs for executing single adjustment command for given consumer.

      Returned double value is always negative.

      Parameters:
      type - Consumer type
      Returns:
      Cost for executing single adjustment command

    • getPenaltyCost

      double getPenaltyCost​(ProducerType type)
      Returns producer dependent weighting factor for energy which was produced but not consumed.

      Returned double value is always negative.

      Parameters:
      type - Producer type
      Returns:
      Producer dependent penalty factor

    • getPenaltyCost

      double getPenaltyCost​(ConsumerType type)
      Returns consumer dependent weighting factor for energy which required but not produced.

      Returned double value is always negative.

      Parameters:
      type - Consumer type
      Returns:
      Consumer dependent penalty factor

    • getCostPerUnit

      double getCostPerUnit​(ProducerType type)
      The cost for each produced unit of energy. The factor depends on the producer type.

      Returned double value is always negative.

      Parameters:
      type - Producer type
      Returns:
      Positive cost for each produced unit
      See Also:
      Statistics.getProductionScore()

    • getCostPerUnit

      double getCostPerUnit​(ConsumerType type)
      The earning (positive cost) for each consumed unit of energy. The factor depends on the consumer type.

      Returned double value is always positive.

      Parameters:
      type - Consumer type
      Returns:
      Positive cost for each consumed unit
      See Also:
      Statistics.getConsumptionScore()

    • getLoadProfileCity

      double[] getLoadProfileCity()

      Returns an array of percentage values of required energy levels of a city over a day. Values are between 0 and 1.

      Each entry in the array represents the required energy level of a city at a specific hour of the day. The index of the an array element indicates the hour of the day. The array contains 24 elements starting from 0 and ending at 23.
      Returns:
      Array of percentage values of required energy levels

    • getLoadProfileCommercialPark

      double[] getLoadProfileCommercialPark()

      Returns an array of percentage values of required energy levels of a commercial park over a day. Values are between 0 and 1.

      Each entry in the array represents the required energy level of a commercial park at a specific hour of the day. The index of the an array element indicates the hour of the day. The array contains 24 elements starting from 0 and ending at 23.
      Returns:
      Array of percentage values of required energy levels
